<br><br>

**Strategic Aim 1** <br> *Produce world-class cross disciplinary research*

:::

::: {style="font-size: 65%;"}

Scoping to characterise **what makes data-driven research world-leading and specify a blueprint for successful data science and Al research**. In-focus will be **composition of academic teams, expert partners and stakeholder organisations, and output types produced** - fundamental papers, software tools, datasets

:::

:::

:::

::: {.notes}

What excellent DS and AI research looks like in your field.
Shifting, so keen to know what the characteristics of impressive data-driven science is.
In my domain: about practice, rigour as much as it is stunning empirical discovery/ methodological innovation. Or maybe bits of both.
Useful to know what others think.
That might present opportunities for spillover / collaboration.


:::

<br><br>

**Strategic Aim 2** <br> *Diversify and increase DS&AI research income*

:::

::: {style="font-size: 65%;"}

Develop **new models** for generating and increasing data science and AI research income, working **with RIS**.

:::

:::

:::

::: {.notes}

Predictable information passing:  scoping out what funding opportunities / grand challenges are out there -- 

Maybe here look at probably more the conditions that need to start actively hitting  opportunities -- maybe useful opportunities for collaboration here 
-- Contact networks, partners etc.


Beyond this session...

:::

<br><br>

**Strategic Aim 3** <br> *Deliver impactful research and innovation*

:::

::: {style="font-size: 65%;"}

Identify **exemplars of impact**, from **applied** and **underpinning data science disciplines**;

Identify key and emerging **research agendas, technologies and methods in modern data science**, specialised to research discipline.

:::

:::

:::

::: {.notes}

Scoping out what impact looks like in your domain / discipline -- this is obvs different depending on discipline.

What are those leading discipline doing in terms of research practice. 

:::

::: {style="font-size: 75%;"}

<br><br>

**Strategic Aim 4** <br> *Develop, support and retain an inclusive research community*

:::

::: {style="font-size: 65%;"}

Attract and nurture LIDA researchers. Proactively encourage new and established staff to partake in LIDA research. Provide guidance and career support.

:::

:::

:::


::: {.notes}

Ideally we want people to engage in Communities and Programmes because it is the obvious thing to do: offers something beyond their immediate school. 

Tricky because it takes time to realise benefits.

Useful to hear experience of running these -- and things that we can do to nurture/support researchers.


:::
